title: Hezbollah introduces new air defense missiles against warplanes
message:
Hezbollah fired Thursday for the first time air defense missiles at Israeli warplanes that the group said were "breaking the sound barrier and terrorizing children."
Hezbollah said in a statement that its air defense missiles forced the warplanes to "retreat beyond the border."
Last month, Hezbollah struck a military post in northern Israel using a drone that fired two missiles, the first successful missile airstrike it has launched from within Israeli airspace.
Israel and Hezbollah have been exchanging fire daily since a day after Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack, which set off the war in Gaza.
In Lebanon, the cross-border violence has killed at least 455 people, mostly fighters but including 88 civilians, according to an AFP tally.

The Lebanese Shia Muslim group’s statement “his air defense missiles forced the warplanes to “retreat beyond the border”...Israeli planes and Hezbollah’s air defenses clashed late Wednesday...The Israeli military said the projectiles were launched by Hezbollah “in response” to earlier Israeli air strikes”.

title: Israeli soldier , 13 Palestinians killed as fierce clashes persist in Gaza : Sources
message:
Image Source: IANS NewsGaza/Jerusalem, June 7 : At least 13 Palestinians were killed in the Israeli bombing of a house and a youth gathering in the Gaza Strip, Palestinian sources have said.
Israeli warplanes on Thursday bombed a house east of Khan Younis city in southern Gaza with at least one missile, Xinhua news agency reported, citing Palestinian security sources.
Medical sources said the airstrike killed eight people, including children and women, and injured several others, all of whom had been taken to hospital.
Meanwhile, the Israeli army claimed that its soldiers encountered Palestinian militants who emerged from a tunnel shaft in southern Gaza, about 200 meters away from the Israeli border.
Earlier in the day, Hamas armed wing Al-Qassam Brigades said it blew up a tunnel entrance set by Israeli forces near Rafah as a trap, killing five Israeli soldiers inside.
event_breakdown: 13 Palestinians were killed in the Israeli bombing of a house and a youth gathering in the Gaza Strip. Israeli forces encountered Palestinian militants who emerged from a tunnel shaft in Rafah.

title: Ukraine takes out 48 of 53 Russian drones and all 5 cruise missiles overnight on June 7
message:
Ukraine takes out 48 of 53 Russian drones and all 5 cruise missiles overnight on June 7Ukrainian air defense forces shot down 48 out of 53 Shahed-131/136 drones and all five Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles overnight on June 7, Ukrainian Air Force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk reported.
Russia launched 53 Shahed drones from Primorsko-Akhtarsk, Yeisk, Kursk, and temporarily occupied Crimea to target Ukraine's critical infrastructure.
Five Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles were fired from Tu-95MS bombers from Russia's Saratov Oblast.
The night-long attack saw cruise missiles heading for western oblasts, with explosions reported in Khmelnytskyi Oblast.

title: US urges Israel to be  fully transparent  after strike on UN school
message:
US urges Israel to be 'fully transparent' after strike on UN school.
Image Source: IANS NewsWashington, June 7 : The United States has called for an investigation into the deadly Israeli airstrike on a school building run by the UN agency (UNRWA) for Palestinian refugees in central Gaza and told Israel it must be "fully transparent."
US State Department spokesman Matthew Miller said on Thursday that even if Israel's army intended to target Hamas militants, the claims of children killed in the strike "show that something went wrong."
He said the US had seen reports that 14 children were killed in the strike.
According to the UNRWA, the school building in the refugee district of Nuseirat was being used as an emergency shelter.

At least 45 people were killed and dozens of others were injured when missiles fired by an Israeli warplane fell on a UN-run school-turned refugee camp in Nuseirat, accommodating 6000 displaced people in central Gaza.

Israel targeted a U.N. school in central Gaza on Thursday, killing at least 32 people and injuring dozens more. The strike occurred just hours after a 2 a.m. airstrike in the same area, which left at least seven people dead. The Pentagon confirmed that the Israel Defense Forces had used a U.S.-made bomb in the attack, which they said was intended to minimize collateral damage.

The Israeli strike on the school was a response to the increasing rocket fire from Gaza that has been targeting Israeli cities. The IDF said that they were targeting terrorists, but the Palestinian health ministry in Gaza said that most of the people killed were civilians. The increase in violence comes in the aftermath of Donald Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel.

title: UNRWA Says Israeli Forces Hit Refugee Camp Without Prior Warning
message:
The UN agency for Palestinian refugees says the deadly Israeli airstrike on a UN-run refugee camp in Gaza was carried out without prior warning to the hundreds of displaced inmates or UNRWA.
At least 45 people were killed and dozens of others were injured when missiles fired by an Israeli warplane fell on a UN-run school-turned refugee camp in Nuseirat, accommodating 6000 displaced people in central Gaza.
Reports quoting the Israeli military said that the strike was only given the go-ahead after aerial surveillance, with additional measures taken to reduce the risk to civilians.
"Attacking, targeting or using UN buildings for military purposes are a blatant disregard of International Humanitarian law," he said in a statement posted on X.
He demanded that targeting UN premises or using them for military purposes must stop, and all those responsible must be held accountable.
event_breakdown:
Israeli Airstrike on a UN-run refugee camp in Gaza
===============================================
According to a UNRWA spokesperson, the deadly Israeli airstrike on a UN-run refugee camp in Gaza was carried out without prior warning to the almost 600 displaced inmates at the camp. The airstrike, which was reportedly given approval after aerial surveillance by the Israeli military, killed over 45 people and maimed dozens of others. The attack was carried out on a UN-run school in Nuseirat that hosts about 6000 homeless families. UNHCR officials denounced the attack as a disregard for international law and called for an end to the targeting of UN premises or their usage for military purposes.

title: Mayor of Gaza Nuseirat killed in Israeli attack : Sources
message:
Gaza, June 7 : The Palestinian Mayor of central Gaza's Nuseirat refugee camp, Iyad al-Mughari, was killed in an Israeli airstrike, Palestinian medical and security sources have said.
The mayor was killed, along with a number of his family members, as an Israeli attack targeted a building in the camp on Thursday, Xinhua news agency reported, citing Palestinian security sources.
Medical sources said al-Mughari's body was transferred to al-Aqsa Hospital in Deir al-Balah city in central Gaza.
Al-Mughari, one of the cadres of the Hamas movement, was appointed mayor by acclamation, the sources noted.
The killing of al-Mughari came hours after the killing of about 35 Palestinians in an Israeli attack on a school affiliated with the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East, which was housing displaced people in the Nuseirat camp.

title: Mayor of Gaza Nuseirat killed in Israeli attack
message:
Gaza, June 7 (UNI) The Palestinian mayor of central Gaza's Nuseirat refugee camp, Iyad al-Mughari, was killed in an Israeli airstrike on Thursday, Palestinian medical and security sources said.
Palestinian security sources told Xinhua that the mayor was killed, along with a number of his family members, as an Israeli attack targeted a building in the camp.
Al-Mughari, one of the cadres of the Hamas movement, was appointed mayor by acclamation, the sources noted.
The killing of al-Mughari came hours after the killing of about 35 Palestinians in an Israeli attack on a school affiliated with the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East, which was housing displaced people in the Nuseirat camp.
The Palestinian death toll from the ongoing Israeli attacks in the enclave has risen to 36,654, with 83,309 people injured, updated the Gaza health authorities on Thursday.

title: Three Killed by Strike on Russian - Held Ukrainian City
message:
A missile attack on the Russian-controlled city of Luhansk in eastern Ukraine on Friday killed four people and injured over 40, Russian officials said.
The eastern Luhansk region is almost entirely under Russian control.
The main city, also called Luhansk, came under a "massive" missile attack, according to its Russia-appointed leader, Leonid Pasechnik.
A section of an apartment block collapsed and the "bodies of four peaceful civilians killed were removed from the rubble," the Moscow-backed region's government said on Telegram, raising the toll from three.
"According to the latest information, 43 people were injured by the missile strike on Luhansk," the regional authorities added.

title: Israeli forces batter central , south Gaza with renewed truce bid at impasse
message:
Israeli forces batter central, south Gaza as tanks advance in Rafahreuters_tickers5 minutesBy Nidal al-MughrabiCAIRO (Reuters) – With a renewed ceasefire push in the eight-month-old Gaza war stalled, Israel bombarded central and southern areas again on Friday, killing at least 28 Palestinians, and tank forces advanced to the western edges of Rafah.
Gaza health officials said two Palestinians had been killed and several wounded in western Rafah from tank shelling there.
In central Gaza, Palestinians medics said at least 15 people died overnight in Israeli bombardments.
In north Gaza, three Palestinians were killed in an Israeli airstrike on a Gaza City school building that was sheltering displaced families, rescue workers said.
Hamas said on Friday militants in the central city of Deir al-Balah shelled a house where Israeli troops were barricaded, killing some and wounding others.

title: Attacco missilistico russo contro Ucraina occidentale
message:
ROMA, 07 GIU - Le forze russe hanno lanciato un attacco missilistico contro l'Ucraina nella notte, prendendo di mira principalmente le regioni occidentali del paese.
Lo riporta il Kyiv Independent, precisando che l'aeronautica militare ucraina ha fatto scattare un'allerta aerea nelle regioni di Ternopil, Khmelnytskyi e Lviv, nonché nella regione della capitale Kiev.
La minaccia è costituita dai missili balistici e da crociera russi, dai bombardieri Tu-95MS e dai droni di tipo Shahed.
A seguito dell'attacco, è scoppiato un incendio in un impianto industriale nell'oblast di Kiev: sul posto sono attualmente presenti le squadre di soccorso per valutare l'entità dei danni e non sono segnalate vittime.
event_breakdown:
Roma, June 7 - Russian forces have launched a missile attack against Ukraine, targeting mainly the western regions of the country.

The Kyiv Independent reports that Ukraine's military air defense has been activated in regions of Ternopil, Khmelnytskyi, Lviv and Kiev.

The threat is constituted by Russian ballistic and cruise missiles, Tu-95MS bombers, as well as Shahed drones.

Following these attacks, a fire has broken out at an industrial park in Kiev Oblast. First responders are at the scene now to assess damage and there are no reports of casualties yet.

Guterres has not stopped short of criticizing Israel since the start of the war in Gaza.

title: Precision and Power Projection : US B - 1B Bomber Conducts First Bomb Drill Over Korea in Seven Years Amid Escalating Tensions
message:
The United States recently showcased its military capabilities and commitment to regional security by conducting a precision-guided bombing drill with a B-1B bomber over the Korean Peninsula—the first such exercise in seven years.
As tensions with North Korea escalate due to a series of provocative actions by Pyongyang, this drill serves as a tangible demonstration of the robust defense posture of the US-South Korea alliance.
North Korea’s recent provocations, such as the launch of balloons carrying refuse across the border into South Korea and attempts to place a spy satellite into orbit, have raised alarms.
Analysts caution that North Korea may view the drill as an aggravation, potentially using it as a pretext to enhance its nuclear arsenal.
The recent exercise, juxtaposed with President Yoon Suk-yeol’s assertive statements, reflects a shift in the South’s approach towards North Korea.
event_breakdown: North Korea – South Korea relations on decline as North Korea tested ballistic missile near Japan.

title: Silac Pathammavong
message:
Silac “Richard” Pathammavong, 91, of Newington, beloved husband of the late Praseuth Pathammavong, passed away peacefully on Tuesday, April 30, 2019 at Vernon Manor.
Born in Laos to the late La and Khammy Pathammavong, he started his distinguished military career by serving in WWII with the French guerrilla forces during the Japanese occupation of French Indochina.
In 1968, he was promoted to brigadier general and assigned to the Commander-in-Chief’s staff of the Royal Lao Army.
He loved to watch boxing matches and warfare movies, but his true passion was his family who will miss him dearly.
A funeral service will be held at 1 PM Saturday, May 11 at the funeral home.

The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has detained a person in Kharkiv Oblast who provided Russian special services with information about events and the location of security and defense forces in the region, the head of the SBU's Main Investigation Directorate, Vasyl Kuibida, said on Channel 24.

"The counterintelligence of the Security Service of Ukraine in Kharkiv Oblast detained a person suspected of carrying out illegal activities on Russia's behalf," Kuibida said.

In May, the partners passed specific operational information to Russia's special services about the movement of Kharkiv citizens' convoys and the officers and equipment of security and defense forces on specific streets, the main investigation directorate said.

In addition, the suspect "supplied Russia with information about the strategy, strength and distribution of military formations of subdivisions," he said.

In particular, the detainee allegedly disclosed to Russia "the movement of checkpoints by Ukrainian troops."

The suspect was detained while allegedly handing over operational information in the area of his residence on June 5, and his criminal case has been sent to court.

The SBU seized 32,000 hryvnia ($1,200), a pocket navigator and an electronic device, among other evidence, during the search of the detainee's apartment.

Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17 (2014) - On July 17, 2014, Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17 was shot down over eastern Ukraine, killing all 298 passengers and crew on board. The disaster was blamed on pro-Russian separatists, who allegedly mistook the passenger jet for a military aircraft.
Charlie Hebdo attack (2015) - On January 7, 2015, gunmen attacked the offices of the French satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo in Paris, killing 12 people (including 10 journalists) and wounding 11 others. The terrorists, who claimed to be acting on behalf of the terrorist group Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, were motivated by the magazine's depiction of the prophet Mohammed.

title: Gaza town says mayor killed in Israeli strike on water station
message:
June 7, 2024 — Deir el-Balah (Palestinian Territories) (AFP)A spokesman for the Nuseirat municipality in central Gaza said Friday that the town's mayor, Iyad al-Maghari, had been killed in an Israeli strike while visiting a water pumping station.
The Israeli army said it was aware of reports that Maghari had been killed in the strike and said he was a Hamas operative.
One resident, Ibrahim al-Hur, told AFP: "We heard several explosions, and we were surprised that the explosions were right next to us, in the nearby water station."
Israel's retaliatory offensive has killed at least 36,731 people in Gaza, also mostly civilians, according to the Hamas-run territory's health ministry.
The violence has left much of Gaza in ruins, and an Israeli siege on the territory has led to dire shortages of clean water and other basic needs.

* Israeli strike kills Palestinian mayor in Gaza water station
* Israel kills Hamas operative in Gaza

title: Israel pounds Gaza refugee camp as war enters ninth month
message:
Palestinians watch smoke billowing following an Israeli air strike in Deir al-Balah (Bashar TALEB)Israeli forces bombarded a Gaza refugee camp Friday after a deadly strike on a UN-school there, as the war sparked by Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel entered its ninth month.
As Gaza faced Israeli attacks from land, sea, and air on Friday, witnesses said the Nuseirat camp in central Gaza was hit again, a day after the Israeli strike on the UN-run school.
The army said the strike targeted Hamas militants operating from a container on the northern Gaza school grounds.
A separate Israeli strike late Thursday killed Nuseirat mayor Iyad al-Mughari as he visited a water pumping station, a municipality spokesman said Friday.
Witnesses also reported Israeli strikes east of Deir al-Balah and intensive fire near the Bureij camp.

Target Event:
Israeli air strikes hit Gaza refugee camp during ongoing conflict with Hamas

title: Israel pounds Gaza refugee camp as war enters ninth month
message:
Israeli forces bombarded a Gaza refugee camp on Friday after a deadly strike on a UN-run school there, as the war sparked by Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel entered its ninth month.
Al-Aqsa Martyrs hospital in Deir al-Balah, central Gaza, said at least 37 people were killed in Thursday's Israeli strike on the UN-run school in Nuseirat camp.
A day after the school was struck, eyewitnesses said the Nuseirat refugee camp came under attack again as Gaza faced Israeli attacks from land, sea, and air.
The Israeli military said it "eliminated dozens of terrorists" in eastern Bureij and Deir al-Balah.
Six people were killed and several wounded in an Israeli strike on the Wafati home in Maghazi camp, said a source at Al-Aqsa Martyrs hospital.
location: The focus of this event is the Nuseirat refugee camp in Gaza.

title: San Jose : Woman arrested in fatal stabbing near downtown
message:
SAN JOSE — A woman has been arrested and charged with murder in the fatal stabbing of a man near downtown San Jose this past weekend, police said.
Sylvia Ortega, 28, a San Jose resident, was arrested Wednesday at a home in the city, according to a San Jose Police Department news release.
Records show that Ortega was booked into the Elmwood women’s jail in Milpitas, where she was initially being held without bail.
She was charged Friday and was scheduled to be arraigned that afternoon in a San Jose courtroom.
Anyone with information about Sunday’s homicide can contact the SJPD homicide unit at 408-277-5283 or email Detective Sgt.

title: US Bombers Drop Live Munitions In Threat To North Korea
message:
The American B-1Bs and two South Korean fighter jets dropped live GBU-38, 500-pound Joint Direct Attack Munitions (JDAMS) on test targets in South Korea.
"This training showcases the incredible capabilities of our combined forces to simultaneously strike multiple targets in a contested environment," said Lt. Gen. David Iverson, US Force Korea deputy commander and Seventh Air Force commander.
In addition to the live test bombing, the US and South Korean air forces conducted yet another round of joint war games.
North Korea has conducted record numbers of weapons tests in recent years – including intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICMBs) – while the US and South Korea engaged in historic war games.
U.S. drops precision-guided bomb in joint drills with South Korea.

title: Will North Korea fly trash balloons into South Korea again ? At look at rising tensions between them
message:
SEOUL, South Korea — South Koreans were alert Friday for possible new launches by North Korea of balloons carrying rubbish into the South, a day after Seoul activists flew their own balloons to scatter political leaflets in the North.
South Korean officials called the North Korean balloon campaign and other recent provocations ''absurd, irrational'' and vowed ''unbearable'' retaliation.
Analysts say the North's action was also likely designed to trigger a divide in South Korea over its conservative government's tough policy on North Korea.
But the North Korean balloons sent into South Korea in recent days carried only garbage, not political leaflets.
In 2015, when South Korea restarted loudspeaker broadcasts after a lapse of 11 years, North Korea fired artillery rounds across the border, prompting South Korea to return fire.

Location: South Korea

title: Toy dog returned to grave of 21 - year - old Ukrainian soldier Hrinka after his mom pleas
message:
A stolen toy dog was returned to the grave of a 21-year-old defender of the Azovstal plant after his mom’s plea.
Photo: ANNATOLLILVNA_1984A toy dog, which is a family heirloom, has been returned to the grave of Nazarii Hryntsevych, alias Hrinka ("Toast"), a fallen Ukrainian soldier from the Azov regiment.
Mariana, Nazarii’s mom, bought this toy dog with her first paycheck when the boy was a year and a half old.
When the 21-year-old defender of the Azovstal plant in the city of Mariupol died in combat, she placed the toy on his grave.
I earned a salary of 700 hryvnias [about US$17] and bought a [toy] dog which cost 500 hryvnias for him.

title: Armor : American M1 Tank Seeks Purpose
message:
The war in Ukraine has made it easier for the U.S. Army to get all the money wanted for upgrades to the American M1 tank force.
The army had already developed and scrutinized a new SEP (System Enhancement Package) update called SEP4 (or SEPV4) for its M1 tanks.
The M1 is an old design with the first of 3,273 M1 tanks produced in 1978.
So far over 10,000 American M1 tanks have been produced and most of them subsequently updated at least once, mainly in the 1990s.
The army is planning to maintain and upgrade its M1 tank fleet of 7,000 vehicles into the 2030s.
event_breakdown:
M1 tanks serve with the U.S. Army in over 20 nations.
They are particularly useful in South Korea.
The Army, advised by the tankers who teach tank crew how to handle their M1s in training classes, can make more efficient via successive upgrades to these war machines.
